TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national , who was born in DATE and was detained in LOC at the time of lodging the application . He was represented before the ORG by Mr İ. Akmeşe , a lawyer practising in GPE .
CARDINAL . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent .
CARDINAL . The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was arrested on suspicion of membership of a terrorist organisation and for illegal possession of explosives .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was placed in detention on remand on the order of the investigating judge .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG filed an indictment with ORG , charging the applicant with membership of a terrorist organisation and illegal possession of explosives , under Articles CARDINAL and CARDINAL of LAW ( Law no . DATE ) .

CARDINAL . DATE and DATE ORG held CARDINAL hearings . At the end of each hearing the court reviewed the applicant ’s pre - trial detention . Taking into account the seriousness of the offence with which the applicant had been charged and the state of the evidence , it decided to keep him in detention . The applicant and his lawyer were present at each hearing .

CARDINAL . After the third hearing , held on DATE , the applicant filed an objection against the detention order and asked to be released . On DATE the Istanbul CARDINALth ORG rejected the applicant ’s request after examining it on the basis of the case file , without holding a hearing . When delivering its decision the Assize court took into account a written opinion filed by the public prosecutor , which was not communicated to the applicant or his lawyer .

CARDINAL . A sixth hearing was held on DATE , after which , on DATE , the ORG court held a hearing to review the applicant ’s detention . The hearing was held ex proprio motu , pursuant to LAW no . CARDINAL , and the decision was delivered on the basis of the case file .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG found the applicant guilty as charged and sentenced him to a total of CARDINAL years’ imprisonment and a fine .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the first - instance court ’s judgment without holding a hearing .
